distribution.text: Copyright © Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Updated release packages that fix several bugs and add various enhancements are now available.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
OpenShift Virtualization is Red Hat's virtualization solution designed for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform. This advisory contains OpenShift Virtualization 4.12.0 RPMs.

Security Fix(es):

* golang: net/http: limit growth of header canonicalization cache (CVE-2021-44716)

* golang: out-of-bounds read in golang.org/x/text/language leads to DoS (CVE-2021-38561)

* golang: syscall: don't close fd 0 on ForkExec error (CVE-2021-44717)

* golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header (CVE-2022-1705)

* golang: go/parser: stack exhaustion in all Parse* functions (CVE-2022-1962)

* golang: regexp: stack exhaustion via a deeply nested expression (CVE-2022-24921)

* golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Skip (CVE-2022-28131)

* golang: io/fs: stack exhaustion in Glob (CVE-2022-30630)

* golang: compress/gzip: stack exhaustion in Reader.Read (CVE-2022-30631)

* golang: path/filepath: stack exhaustion in Glob (CVE-2022-30632)

* golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Unmarshal (CVE-2022-30633)

* golang: encoding/gob: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Decode (CVE-2022-30635)

* golang: net/http/httputil: NewSingleHostReverseProxy - omit X-Forwarded-For not working (CVE-2022-32148)

* golang: crypto/tls: session tickets lack random ticket_age_add (CVE-2022-30629)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: OpenShift Virtualization 4.12.0 RPMs security update

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. The language package for go language can panic due to an out-of-bounds read when an incorrectly formatted language tag is being parsed. This flaw allows an attacker to cause applications using this package to parse untrusted input data to crash, leading to a denial of service of the affected component.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: out-of-bounds read in golang.org/x/text/language leads to DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This flaw may be triggered only by accepting untrusted user input to the vulnerable golang's library. The overall DoS attack vector depends directly on how the library's input is exposed by the consuming application, thus Red Hat rates impact as Moderate.

In Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes (RHACM) 2.5 version, the registration-operator, lighthouse-coredns, lighthouse-agent, gatekeeper-operator, and discovery-operator components are affected by this flaw, but the rest of the components are using an already patched version and are unaffected. For 2.4 and previous versions of Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes (RHACM), most of the components are affected.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: out-of-bounds read in golang.org/x/text/language leads to DoS

notes.text: There's an uncontrolled resource consumption flaw in golang's net/http library in the canonicalHeader() function. An attacker who submits specially crafted requests to applications linked with net/http's http2 functionality could cause excessive resource consumption that could lead to a denial of service or otherwise impact to system performance and resources.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http: limit growth of header canonicalization cache
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
For OpenShift Container Platform, OpenShift Virtualization, Red Hat Quay and OpenShift distributed tracing the most an attacker can possibly achieve by exploiting this vulnerability is to crash a container, temporarily impacting availability of one or more services. Therefore impact is rated Moderate.

In its default configuration, grafana as shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 is not affected by this vulnerability. However, enabling http2 in /etc/grafana/grafana.ini explicitly would render grafana affected, therefore grafana has been marked affected.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

This flaw can be mitigated by disabling HTTP/2. Setting the GODEBUG=http2server=0 environment variable before calling Serve will disable HTTP/2 unless it was manually configured through the golang.org/x/net/http2 package.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http: limit growth of header canonicalization cache

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: There's a flaw in golang's syscall.ForkExec() interface. An attacker who manages to first cause a file descriptor exhaustion for the process, then cause syscall.ForkExec() to be called repeatedly, could compromise data integrity and/or confidentiality in a somewhat uncontrolled way in programs linked with and using syscall.ForkExec().
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: syscall: don't close fd 0 on ForkExec error
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
* This flaw has had the severity level set to Moderate due to the attack complexity required to exhaust file descriptors at the time ForkExec is called, plus an attacker does not necessarily have direct control over where/how data is leaked.

* For Service Telemetry Framework, because the flaw's impact is lower, no update will be provided at this time for its containers.

* runc shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and 9 are not affected by this flaw because the flaw is already patched in the shipped versions.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
This bug can be mitigated by raising the per-process file descriptor limit.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: syscall: don't close fd 0 on ForkExec error

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. The HTTP/1 client accepted invalid Transfer-Encoding headers indicating "chunked" encoding. This issue could allow request smuggling, but only if combined with an intermediate server that also improperly accepts the header as invalid.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header

notes.text: A flaw was found in the golang standard library, go/parser. When calling any Parse functions on the Go source code, which contains deeply nested types or declarations, a panic can occur due to stack exhaustion. This issue allows an attacker to impact system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: go/parser: stack exhaustion in all Parse* functions
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: go/parser: stack exhaustion in all Parse* functions

notes.text: A stack overflow flaw was found in Golang's regexp module, which can crash the runtime if the application using regexp accepts very long or arbitrarily long regexps from untrusted sources that have sufficient nesting depths. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to send large regexps with deep nesting to the application. Triggering this flaw leads to a crash of the runtime, which causes a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: regexp: stack exhaustion via a deeply nested expression
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw has been rated as a Moderate impact flaw because the exploitation of this flaw requires that an affected application accept arbitrarily long regexps from untrusted sources, which has inherent risks (even without this flaw), especially involving impacts to application availability.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: regexp: stack exhaustion via a deeply nested expression

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang encoding/xml. When calling Decoder, Skip while parsing a deeply nested XML document, a panic can occur due to stack exhaustion and allows an attacker to impact system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Skip
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Skip

notes.text: A flaw was found in the crypto/tls golang package. When session tickets are generated by crypto/tls, it is missing the ticket expiration. This issue may allow an attacker to observe the TLS handshakes to correlate successive connections during session resumption.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: crypto/tls: session tickets lack random ticket_age_add
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: crypto/tls: session tickets lack random ticket_age_add

notes.text: A flaw was found in the golang standard library, io/fs. Calling Glob on a path that contains a large number of path separators can cause a panic issue due to stack exhaustion. This could allow an attacker to impact availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: io/fs: stack exhaustion in Glob
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: io/fs: stack exhaustion in Glob

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. Calling the Reader, Read method on an archive that contains a large number of concatenated 0-length compressed files can cause a panic issue due to stack exhaustion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: compress/gzip: stack exhaustion in Reader.Read
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: compress/gzip: stack exhaustion in Reader.Read

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. Calling Glob on a path that contains a large number of path separators can cause a panic issue due to stack exhaustion. This can cause an attacker to impact availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: path/filepath: stack exhaustion in Glob
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The exploitation of this flaw will only result in a denial of service via the application crashing which is why this has been rated as moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. Calling Unmarshal on an XML document into a Go struct, which has a nested field that uses the "any" field tag, can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Unmarshal
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Unmarshal

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. When calling Decoder, Decode on a message that contains deeply nested structures, a panic can occur due to stack exhaustion and allows an attacker to impact system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: encoding/gob: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Decode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) starting from 4.10 stream is already compiled in the patched version of Go, hence is not affected by this vulnerability.The vulnerability has been rated as moderate instead of high because the vulnerability can only result in a minor denial of service.
notes.title: Statement

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A flaw was found in net/http/httputil golang package. When httputil.ReverseProxy.ServeHTTP is called with a Request.Header map containing a nil value for the X-Forwarded-For header, ReverseProxy could set the client IP incorrectly. This issue may affect confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http/httputil: NewSingleHostReverseProxy - omit X-Forwarded-For not working
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
